comments.body:
Previous comment seems to be go away so adding again (please avoid force pushing unless there's some conflict):

Throwing IllegalArgumentException sounds really weird if there's no argument. IMHO that should be some exception (even a new class) clearly representing the intention.

Why allow a source to reject a vacuum operation?

If vacuuming is supported, then the source should always do the operation when requested. I don't see a reason why the source would need to reject it.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +13,17 @@   * deleting stale records.
   *
   * @throws IllegalArgumentException If the vacuum is rejected due to required effort.
   */
  void vacuum();

comments.body:
Should this be "unneeded metadata" instead?

I think that the behavior should be that vacuum does not modify the table's contents. DML operations should be used for that. Vacuum only cleans up metadata for faster operations, like an OPTIMIZE.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +10,14 @@
  /**
   * Performs maintenance on the table.  This often includes removing unneeded data and
   * deleting stale records.
   *
